values.concise:
(CRITICAL DIRECTIVE : 150-300 words summary output)
Brief summary with essential points and minimal supporting details for quick reading.
values.normal:
(CRITICAL DIRECTIVE : 400-700 words)
Balanced summary with appropriate depth, important details, and context while maintaining readability.
values.detailed:
(CRITICAL DIRECTIVE : 800-1200 words)
Substantial depth covering important concepts, examples, and comprehensive analysis of significant elements.
values.exhaustive:
(CRITICAL DIRECTIVE : 1500-3000+ words)
Maximum thoroughness covering all aspects in detail with concept explanations, multiple supporting details, implications, and context. Use sections and subsections for academic-level comprehensiveness.

values.adaptive: Dynamically structure summary based on content type: narrative flow for stories/experiences, hierarchical organization for informational content, chronological structure for processes/tutorials, and comparative format for discussions. Begin with content type identification followed by optimized summary approach.
values.narrative: Present content as an engaging story with introduction, logical progression of key points, and conclusion that synthesizes main insights. Adapt flow to content type, maintaining narrative cohesion throughout.
values.bulletPoints: Organize in scannable hierarchy with clear sections and concise bullet points. Structure with overview, key points, supporting evidence, and conclusions. Adapt sections based on content type.
values.analytical: Present a critical evaluation that identifies main arguments, assesses evidence quality, and examines underlying assumptions. Include strengths/weaknesses and contextual significance. Adapt analytical depth based on content complexity.
values.executive: Focus on actionable insights and practical takeaways. Structure with context, key findings, implications, and recommended actions. Prioritize decision-relevant information with business/practical value.
values.simplified: Translate complex concepts into accessible, jargon-free language anyone can understand. Use analogies, examples, and plain language while preserving core insights. Especially useful for technical or academic content.
values.technical: Preserve technical accuracy with precise terminology, specifications, and methodologies. Structure with problem statement, technical approach, implementation details, and results/conclusions. Include relevant code snippets, algorithms, formulas, or technical parameters. Prioritize reproducibility and technical clarity.
values.academic: Structure as a scholarly abstract with clear research context, theoretical framework, methodology, findings, and implications. Emphasize epistemological foundations, methodological rigor, and scholarly significance. Maintain precise academic terminology, balanced critical assessment, and connections to relevant literature. Include limitations and directions for future inquiry when applicable.

values.true: After completing your summary, add a section with additional background information that helps understand this content's significance. Scale depth with length parameter.
After completing your summary, fact-check the information provided in the post and comments. Identify any misinformation or inaccuracies and provide corrections or clarifications.
